attributes.action: Implement the Freedom of Movement (FoM) directive (2004/38/EC) more effectively
attributes.additional_details:
This petition notes that “European migrants living in the UK contribute £2,300 more to public purse each year than the average adult, suggesting a net contribution of £78,000 to the exchequer over their lifespan in the UK”. OxfordEconomics Fiscal Impact Study

See:
2004/38/EC Directive
Article 3(2) of the TEU (Treaty of the European Union)
Article 21 & Titles IV & V of the TFEU (Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union)
Article 45 of the Chamber of Fundamental Rights of the European Union
attributes.background:
The FoM directive states that any Union citizen must have sufficient resources and sickness insurance to ensure they do not become a burden on the UK’s social services if staying longer than 3 months.

The UK can also require any Union citizen to register with the authorities as necessary.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we aren't sure what you mean by implementing the directive "more directly".

You could start a new petition setting out clearly what aspects of the Directive you would like the UK Government to apply.
